string-array.item: Mashrafe Bin Mortaza (born 5 October 1983 in Narail District) is a Bangladesh international cricketer, and current captain of the One Day Internationals for Bangladesh national cricket team. He is also a former T20I captain, until his retirement.

Shakib Al Hasan is a Bangladeshi international cricketer who holds the record for being ranked first as an all rounder in the One Day International format for 10 years and is still among the top 3 in highest current rankings in all three formats of the game.

Tamim Iqbal Khan is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. Tamim made his One Day International debut in 2007 and played his first Test the following year. He served as vice-captain of the national side between December 2010 and September 2011.

Mushfiqur Rahim is a Bangladeshi cricketer and the former captain of the Bangladesh national cricket team. Between August 2009 and December 2010 Rahim served as Bangladesh vice-captain in all formats. He was ranked as one of the worlds most famous athletes by ESPN WORLD FAME 100 in 2019.

Mahmudullah Riyad, commonly known as Mahmudullah, is a Bangladeshi cricketer and the current Test and T20I vice-captain. He has played First-class and List A cricket for Dhaka Division and has represented Bangladesh in all forms of the game.

Soumya Sarkar is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He is a left-handed batsman, right arm fast-medium bowler. Sarkar plays for the Rangpur Riders in the Bangladesh Premier League, Khulna Division in the National Cricket League, and Prime Bank Cricket Club in the Dhaka Premier Division.
Liton Kumar Das is a Bangladeshi cricketer. He is a right-handed opening batsman and wicket-keeper.

Mustafizur Rahman is a Bangladeshi international cricketer. He is specialized as a left-arm fast-medium bowler. He has taken the most wickets in a debut One Day International series. He is the first player to win the Man of the Match award on both Test as well as ODI debuts.
